title: Drawing, Design after Paintings by Raphael and Paintings in Bologna by Albani, Francia, Parmigianino; Monument Verso: Anatomical Study, 1811–14
title_raw: Design after Paintings by Raphael and Paintings in Bologna by Albani, Francia, Parmigianino; Monument Verso: Anatomical Study
medium: Pen and ink, brush and sepia wash with grayish-brown watercolor washes over traces of graphite on laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Double sided sheet from sketchbook. Recto, sheet divided into six rectangles, each showing unique scene. Top left rectangle, Isaiah shown between two angels, inscription on tablet between angles: ISAIA 1811. Also inscription below rectangle: Raffaello Roma. Top right rectangle, Diana and Actaeon with inscription below: Albani Bologna.  Middle rectangle, families of Virgin and Elizabeth. Inscription below: Francia Bologna. Bottom right rectangle, Virgin teaches child to read. Inscription below: Parmigianino Bologna. Bottom middle rectangle, Adonis starting hunt. Inscribed below: Parmigianino Bologna. At left top corner, "141" and at left bottom corner "78". Verso, three anatomical studies of arms, indicating muscles and bones. Three caricature heads in profile.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design after Paintings by Raphael and Paintings in Bologna by Albani, Francia, Parmigianino; Monument Verso: Anatomical Study, 1811–14. Pen and ink, brush and sepia wash with grayish-brown watercolor washes over traces of graphite on laid paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1212
